intro: Baccaurea sparsiflora, commonly known as the sparse-flowered bacco, is a tropical plant belonging to the Sapotaceae family. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically ovate to elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by fleshy, orange-red berries. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest in botanical research and horticulture.
